photo.description: View On Black «La natura ha migliaia e migliaia di colori, e noi ci siamo messi in testa di ridurne la scala solo ad una ventina.» Hermann Hesse ---------------------------------------------------------- «Mi sembra che tutti noi guardiamo troppo alla Natura e viviamo troppo poco con essa.» Oscar Wilde ------------------------------------------------------ Tom Baxter - "Better" it.youtube.com/watch?v=ZxJDy9vxyqo "...I’ll stand by you, If you stand by me. I think time that I, reveal it, ‘Cos I believe it - It’s better. See what I’m trying to say is: You make things - better And no matter what the day is, With you here - it’s better...."

photo.title: Non c'è creatura troppo piccola o insignificante che non possa avere qualcosa da dare per rendere questo mondo migliore. (Sergio Bambarèn)

photo.description: After wandering around the garden a bit, we finally found the main villa. A little bit about this museum - it only allows 360 people in for two hours at a time. You really need to make reservations in advance. Our time was for 11am - 1pm -- Will booked our tickets on-line at home.

photo.title: The Villa Borghese

photo.description: Day 133. Back to vacation photos for a bit. Eight more days to go. Our first day in Rome was a bit hectic, as it took us a while to get organized and out the door in the morning. Our goal was the Villa Borghese, and specifically a 1:00 pm reservation for the Galleria Borghese. Isaac and I managed to get out of the apartment somewhat before everybody else, and we had some time to wander around the gardens before meeting up for sandwiches and the museum (which Isaac skipped, thanks to my father-in-law who generously offered to take him to a playground so the rest of us could enjoy the Bernini sculptures in the museum toddler-free). Isaac was in a cooperative mood, and was quite happy to show off one of his favorite vacation activities for the camera: 1) find a fountain. 2) find some rocks. 3) drop rocks in fountain, watch the splash. 4) repeat. Rocks were quite a theme for us. Not only did he enjoy throwing them in fountains, but he left little piles of rocks on benches all over Italy, and collected several Ziploc bags full of them for us to take home. Two more rock shots in the comments. Taken May 12, 2012 in Rome, Lazio, Italy ¹⁄₄₀₀ sec at f/7.1, ISO100, no flash. Lens: EF50mm f/1.4 USM
photo.tags: 365photoproject fountain naturalobjects rocks structures triptych rome lazio italy villaborghese
photo.title: Fountain + Rocks = Splash [133/366]

photo.description: Rome (Italy). This 19th century "Temple of Aesculapius" was built purely as a landscape feature. It is located near the lake in the Villa Borghese gardens.
